column4: I've but a SATA hdd that has SMART capability into a USB enclosure and now it seems that the I can't get info using SMART. Is this a limitation of the enclosure or USB?
the enclosure won't translate low-level stuff like that across a USB. it's basically a mobo emulator with a hotplug USB connection
thank you for the clarification. No way around it then?
nope. you'll either have to plug it into a real mobo or cope
any idea regarding my previous question about lm-sensors?
apparently a USB3 enclosure supports SMART...
never had much success with the hard sensors in my boxen, sorry. if I'm concerned about heating, I have a laser thermometer
all the ones I've seen that let you plug your own drive into them were pretty simple. Apparently they've gotten better since the last time I bought one

ahh okay. I'm not too concerned but I was curious about the GPU temp. The board came with a very noisy little fan on the intel GPU. I removed it and put a decent 120mm fan on the outside of the case instead. The CPU temp went from 39degrees to 20degrees, so I hope the gpu temp also decreased :)
only coretemp readings. core0 and core1
however the motherboard tech specs say it has more.
running sensors-detect finds another module and loads it but doesn't display anything
